task.question: Who was to ask the Egyptians for their wealth and plunder Egypt (Ex. 3:22)?
How were the Israelites NOT to leave Egypt (Ex. 3:22)?
To which of Moses' objections did God respond by saying What is that in your hand? (Ex. 4:2)?

choices.choice: They will ask me what is his [God's] name
Who am I that I should go to Pharaoh?
What if they [Israelites] do not believe me?

task.answer: What if they [Israelites] do not believe me?

task.question: When Moses threw his staff on the ground, what did it become (Ex. 4:3)?
The LORD gave Moses signs so that the Israelites would believe that the God of all of the following EXCEPT _______ had sent Moses (Ex. 4:5)
What belief-causing sign happened when Moses put his hand into his cloak (Ex. 4:6)?

choices.choice: His hand became a mighty sword

task.question: What third miraculous sign did God give Moses to convince the Israelites to believe that he had met with God (Ex. 4:9)?

choices.choice: Causing the sky to become dark
Making frogs come out of the Nile

task.question: How did God respond to Moses' object that he had never been eloquent in speech (Ex. 4:11)?

choices.choice: God asked him who made man's mouth
Moses was unable to speak for three days
God asked him if bushes could talk

task.answer: God asked him who made man's mouth

task.question: Moses final objection was to ask God to send someone else. How did God respond to that final objection (Ex. 4:14)?

choices.choice: He said that Aaron the Levite could speak well
He would put his words into Moses' mouth
The bush flared up with tongues of fire

task.answer: He said that Aaron the Levite could speak well

task.question: Who would put words into Aaron's mouth (Ex. 4:15)?
